title: MultiNiftiMasker should implement transform in parallel
MultiNiftiMasker should implement transform in parallel

text:
Awesome. We need to talk to @ogrisel about shelving. You should sit down
with him and explain the usecase and show the codebase.

I thought too... I have a branch with that work but I think I never made the PR because it is intricated with another modification (shelving). I am rebasing it right now, it shouldn't be too much work to remove shelving and keep only the parallel part.

Rebasing is done. I'll remove the shelving ASAP. I'll do some tests to validate the code. I can do the PR in the early afternoon or you can use my "parallel_multi" branch (you must have a joblib version that support shelving, or comment the MemorizedResult import).

Before:

```
Fetching dataset... Done (0.00s).
Preprocessing data...
real    0m49.777s
user    0m39.306s
sys     0m10.181s
```

After:

```
Fetching dataset... Done (0.00s).
Preprocessing data...
real    0m10.449s
user    0m42.775s
sys     0m12.517s
```
This has been solved.

text: Adresses #113
title: Make MultiNiftiMasker run in parallel

text: Adresses #113
title: Make MultiNiftiMasker run in parallel

text:
I am not too excited about the 'reference_affine' argument that pops up in filter_and_mask. The reason being that filter_and_mask is a fairly general function that can be used by end users, whereas reference_affine is for internal reasons, and makes no sens outside of the scope in which it is used.

I suggest that a new function, say '_safe_filter_and_mask' should be created, that does the checking and calls filer_and_mask after resetting the 'target_affine'. WDYT?

> For me, filter_and_mask is an internal function.

Well, it pops up in so many places that we need to consider it as public
(and besides, it has no leading underscore). In essence, it is the
function form of the NiftiMasker.

Maybe we should document and advertise it. But let's worry about this
later.
Merged! Thanks

This is unfortunately the most elegant solution I found to handle the problem of heterogeneous affines. For me, filter_and_mask is an internal function. If you want to expose it, then creating a wrapper is indeed the way to go to handle the reference_affine case. I don't think that reference_affine could be of any use for end users.
Wrapper created !
The reason that this was below the verbosity is to be able to have a display giving the filename ans not the NiftiImage object. Is there a reason that you moved it above?

title: (None, '', u'nilearn/input_data/base_masker.py')

text:
I did not think about the filename case.
The 200 character limitation must concern the case when niimgs are numpy arrays. If niimgs is a filename then I'd like to have the full filename and not a truncated version (path to dataset files can be very long sometimes). I think we should put the number of characters as an option of repr_niimgs and use it only when it's not a numpy array.
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/input_data/base_masker.py')

text:
> The 200 character limitation must concern the case when niimgs are
> numpy arrays. If niimgs is a filename then I'd like to have the full
> filename and not a truncated version (path to dataset files can be very
> long sometimes). I think we should put the number of characters as an
> option of repr_niimgs and use it only when it's not a numpy array.

OK. However, do you think that we need an extra option? Can't repr_niimgs
figure this out by itself?

Anyhow, I think that I'd like a different PR for that.
